meanings.definition: To carry or haul something heavy or awkward.
meanings.sent1: I was shlepping my suitcase up the stairs.
meanings.sent2: She shlepped the groceries from the car to the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: He looked like he was shlepping a ton of bricks when carrying the boxes.
meanings.sent4: The old truck shlepped the load up the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The porter was shlepping the luggage with great effort.

meanings.sent1: The turtle was shlepping along the path.
meanings.sent2: The tired hiker shlepped through the thick mud.
meanings.sent3: The snail was shlepping its shell like it was in no rush.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to shlep by as we waited for the bus.
meanings.sent5: The sloth was shlepping from tree to tree with its slow movements.

meanings.definition: To travel with difficulty or inconvenience.
meanings.sent1: We were shlepping through the crowded airport to catch our flight.
meanings.sent2: The family shlepped their luggage through the narrow alleyways of the old town.
meanings.sent3: The kids were shlepping their backpacks as if they were on a never-ending journey.
meanings.sent4: The tired travelers shlepped across the desert under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent5: She was shlepping through the snowstorm to get to the cozy cabin.
